The request number for which data needs to be fetched
The request number for which data needs to be fetched
GUID SessionId. Unique for each user session

member.name: M:Microsoft.CFS.Approvals.CoreServices.Controllers.api.v1.DetailController.Get(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves details of approval item from tenant once a user clicks into the summary tile on the initial page.
member.param: Indicates the Tenant for which the request's (documentNumber) data needs to be retrieved
The request number for which data needs to be fetched
The operation type (authsum/DTL/HDR/LINE) etc. This operation specifies what type of data will be retrieved
Fiscal Year of Request number (if any)
GUID SessionId. Unique for each user session
GUID Transaction Id. Unique for each transaction
GUID Cross Correlation Vector. Unique for each request across system boundaries
Data Call Type which can be either Summary or Details OR All
Page from where API is called eg. Detail, History
Source for Details call eg. Summary, Notification
member.returns: This method returns the request's details data from storage if all data (Header/Additional Data/Line Items data) are present in storage along with authsum (Summary) data else only the summary data along with the list of Callback URLs for missing data. Per the information regarding a single approval, the details for that approval request are returned. The details can include attachments and other options depending on the tenant, which means details can vary per certain tenant's requirements.

remarks.para: e.g. Gets all data for the documentNumber (includes summary/header/line data as well) HTTP GET api/Detail/[tenantId]/[documentNumber]

e.g. Gets only specific data for the documentNumber (either header/line etc.). This is called when there are some missing details for that documentNumber and these additional missing details needs to be fetched from the LOB system HTTP GET api/Detail/[tenantMapId]/[documentNumber]/[operation]

member.name: M:Microsoft.CFS.Approvals.CoreServices.Controllers.api.v1.DocumentActionController.Post(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends action of a given approval request whether it's an approval, rejection, etc... The user is subsequently notified once the action is processed and completed through the notification center. The ActionString is a part of the HttpRequest's Content, which contains details regarding the type of action taken; the request or DocumentNumber on which action needs to be taken; the comments added by the approver; and additional information (if any)
member.param: The Approval Request object
The Unique TenantId (Int32) for which the action needs to be performed for the given request or documentNumber
GUID SessionId. Unique for each user session
Client Device

member.name: M:Microsoft.CFS.Approvals.CoreServices.Controllers.api.v1.DocumentActionController.Post(System.Int32,Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends action of a given approval request whether it's an approval, rejection, etc... The user is subsequently notified once the action is processed and completed through the notification center. The ActionString is a part of the HttpRequest's Content, which contains details regarding the type of action taken; the request or DocumentNumber on which action needs to be taken; the comments added by the approver; and additional information (if any)
member.param: The Unique TenantId (Int32) for which the action needs to be performed for the given request or documentNumber
ActionString is Json Content, which contains details regarding the type of action
GUID SessionId. Unique for each user session
Client Device

member.name: M:Microsoft.CFS.Approvals.CoreServices.Controllers.api.v1.DocumentDownloadController.Get(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves attachment file for download on the details page from the tenant LOB system that the approval belongs to.
member.param: Indicates the Tenant for which the request's (documentNumber) data needs to be retrieved
The request number for which data needs to be fetched
The request number for which data needs to be fetched
Fiscal Year of Request number (if any)
The unique attachmentId of the attachment to be downloaded from LOB system
GUID SessionId. Unique for each user session
GUID Transaction Id. Unique for each transaction
GUID Cross Correlation Vector. Unique for each request across system boundaries
member.returns: This method connects to the LOB system and based on the input parameters (documentNumber/attachmentId), downloads the Attachment for the request and return that to the client device as a HttpResponse

remarks.para: e.g. This is called when there is no specific attachmentId HTTP GET api/DocumentDownload/[tenantId]/[documentNumber]
e.g. This is called when there is fiscalyear and attachmentId specified HTTP GET api/DocumentDownload/[tenantId]/[documentNumber]/[fiscalYear]/[attachmentId]

member.name: M:Microsoft.CFS.Approvals.CoreServices.Controllers.api.v1.DocumentDownloadController.Post(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves attachment file for download on the details page from the tenant LOB system that the approval belongs to.
member.param: Indicates the Tenant for which the request's (documentNumber) data needs to be retrieved
GUID SessionId. Unique for each user session
GUID Transaction Id. Unique for each transaction
member.returns: This method connects to the LOB system and based on the request content (list of documentNumbers), downloads all the Attachment for the set of requests and return that to the client device as a compressed file in a HttpResponse

member.name: M:Microsoft.CFS.Approvals.CoreServices.Controllers.api.v1.ReadDetailsController.Post(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates row in ReadDetails Table to indicate that details of a particular approval were successfully loaded, and therefore have been read. Entries from this controller stored in the table include PartitionKey, RowKey (alias), TimeStamp, and JSONData. JSON Data includes ActionDate, User who took action (alias), and the action (Read Details). JSON Data also stores the document key relative to the approval as well as which client the details were loaded on.
member.param: The Unique TenantId (Int32) for which the action needs to be performed for the given request or documentNumber
GUID SessionId. Unique for each user session
GUID Transaction Id. Unique for each transaction
GUID Cross Correlation Vector. Unique for each request across system boundaries
